title: General Motors (GM) Sounds the Alarm on Massive Recall amid Engine Defect Concerns
description: Detailed price information for General Motors Company (GM-N) from The Globe and Mail including charting and trades.
content: General Motors (GM) has announced a global recall of about 721,000 SUVs and trucks due to potential engine defects that could lead to a loss of power and increase the risk of accidents. This recall, a... [2551 symbols]

entities.data: the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration

summary: General Motors (GM) has announced a global recall of about 721,000 SUVs and trucks due to potential engine defects that could lead to a loss of power and increase the risk of accidents. The affected vehicles are Cadillac, Chevrolet, and GMC models spanning 2021 through 2024. The recall follows over 28,000 complaints related to engine failures, including 12 reported crashes, 12 injuries, and 42 fires potentially linked to this issue. GM estimates that only about 3% of the recalled vehicles have the defect, but is taking proactive steps to ensure customer safety. The company has also asked dealers to inspect affected vehicles and repair or replace the engine free of charge.
shortSummary: General Motors is recalling 721,000 SUVs and trucks due to potential engine defects, following previous safety recalls and ongoing issues with engine failures.

title: General Motors recall 721 thousand cars because of defective machines
description: Photo: Chevrolet The company works as quickly as possible and ensures that customer safety is its highest priority. General Motors announced a large-scale review of nearly 721 thousand cars in the world, where there were nearly 598 thousand in the USA, due to a 6.2-liter V8 engine problem that could…
content:
The company works as quickly as possible and ensures that customer safety is its highest priority.

General Motors announced a large-scale review of nearly 721 thousand cars in the world, where there ... [1716 symbols]
summary: General Motors (GM) has recalled nearly 721 thousand cars globally, with nearly 598 thousand in the US. The decision was made after receiving 39 complaints about the destruction of machines. The affected models include popular cars 2021–2024, including Cadillac Escalade and Escalades ESV, Chevy Silverado 1500, Suburban and Tahoe, and GMC Sierra 1500, Yukon and Yukon XL. The recall is due to a 6.2-liter V8 engine problem that could lose power or fail. All cars that fall under the campaign must pass an inspection and if found any defects, they will be repaired or completely replaced. The company also suspended sales of associated models in dealerships.
shortSummary: General Motors is recalling nearly 721,000 cars globally due to potentially faulty V8 engines, potentially leading to power loss and mechanical failure.

title: General Motors (NYSE: GM) Price Prediction and Forecast 2025-2030 (April 2025)
description: General Motors is "all-in" on adding EVs to its product line but faces some legal headwinds.
content: Shares of General Motors (NYSE: GM) slid 4.30% over the past month, compounding a difficult start to the year that has seen the stock lose 12.38%. The legacy automaker continues to struggle as the fal... [5551 symbols]
summary: Shares of General Motors (NYSE: GM) have dropped 4.30% over the past month, following a difficult start to the year that saw the stock lose 12.38%. The company's stock, which sources its parts from a global network of 3,100 primary suppliers and has significant presence in Mexico, Canada, and Asia, has seen a 1.03% gain over the last year. However, it has produced a 115.22% return over five years. The company’s EV segment is expected to be in the black with models like the Hummer EV, Chevy Silverado EV, and Cadillac Lyriq already on the market. In 2021, GM secured a deal with LG Chem Ltd. to supply enough cathode materials to build 5 million EV vehicles, and between 2022 and 2023, its EV production will increase to deliver over 400,000 vehicles. The firm's share price is currently at $54.54, according to analysts.
shortSummary: General Motors shares fell 4.30% amid tough trading and challenges, with strong growth prospects and a strategic partnership with Uber boosting investor confidence.

keywords.name: Cadillac Escalade and Escalade ESV models
the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration

entities.data: the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration

summary: General Motors (GM) has issued a recall for over 720,000 vehicles worldwide due to potential engine problems. The affected vehicles include Cadillac Escalade and Escalades, along with several other models. The recall affects approximately 598,000 cars in the United States and involves models from 2021 through 2024. The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration received 39 complaints about engine failures. GM reported 12 crashes and 12 injuries in the U.S. that could be related to the engine issues.
shortSummary: General Motors is recalling over 700,000 vehicles globally due to potential engine issues, following a National Highway Traffic Safety Administration investigation.

title: Engine failure risk leads to massive GM recall
description: Approximately 597,630 vehicles are affected, according to the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration.
content:
General Motors has issued a safety recall for several vehicles across several of the auto giant’s main brands.

The company is currently recalling certain SUVs and trucks sold under the Cadillac, GMC ... [1692 symbols]

entities.data: the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration

summary: General Motors (GM) has issued a safety recall for several vehicles across several of its main brands, including Cadillac, GMC, and Chevrolet, due to manufacturing issues with some engine components. Approximately 597,630 vehicles are affected by the recall. The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration stated that these issues were caused by issues with the connecting rods and crankshaft, which could lead to engine damage or failure. Only vehicles with 6.2L L87 V8 engines are affected. Owners can contact GM to bring their vehicle into a dealership to inspect the engine cylinder and repair or replace it as needed.
shortSummary: General Motors is recalling nearly 600,000 vehicles due to potential engine failure issues, requiring urgent repair and replacement options from dealers.
